wikipedia_page.main:
Michael Evans (3 May 1908 – 14 November 1974) was an English cricketer. Evans was a right-handed batsman who bowled right-arm fast-medium. He was born at Leicester, Leicestershire.
Evans made two first-class appearances for Leicestershire against Surrey and Glamorgan in the 1946 County Championship. In his two matches he scored a total of 26 runs at an average of 8.66, with a high score of 14 not out. With the ball, he took 6 wickets at a bowling average of 21.66, with best figures of 3/30.He died at the city of his birth on 14 November 1974.
